favourite.article: Thank You, Lord Jesus, for capturing me. Lord, I give all for Your masterpiece!
Lord I choose You and none other. Thank You for capturing me for joining me to You. O Lord I love You always.
Lord You are my choice! I have seen Your beauty, I belong to You, now and evermore!
Eph 2:10 For we are His masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand in order that we would walk in them.
You're my only choice Lord, You are so lovely. I'll love You always. Hallelujah!!!
Thank You, Lord, I’m part of God’s masterpiece!!
Lord I give all for Your masterpiece! What a privilege it is that we can be part of Your masterpiece!!
Thank You, Lord, I'm part of God's masterpiece. What a privilege!
Lord Jesus, cause Your life to increase in us today! Gain Your masterpiece, Your building, Your bride!
Lord Jesus, You are my choice! I love You.
Thank You Lord for commanding us to love You with all our heart...Lord recover our hearts to love You more with the best love... I love You Lord Jesus...
"Lord, I love You. There is no other." Keep me loving You, Lord.
Thank You Lord for there is no other like You. Loving You recovers our hearts.
Praise The Lord! I am His masterpiece!
Lord, thank You that I'm part of Your masterpiece.

This hymn reminds us how we become part of God's masterpiece. It is not by our own effort but rather by Christ's death on the cross and in His resurrection, now as the life-giving Spirit being imparted into us. Praise the Lord.
We sang this song at the October Retreat...Amen! We just need to love the Lord! Thank You, Lord, I'm part of God's masterpiece!

Lord, I love You and there is no other. Ever since I was a little girl I've always loved this hymn. It was precious to me. Reminds me of my experience of Christ of how He captured my heart...there's no turning back!!! Everyday I just want to tell You, Lord, I love because You first loved me, until my last breath...Lord, thank You I'm part of Your masterpiece-THE CHURCH.

We are God's poiema, God's masterpiece. The heavens, the earth, man are all not God's masterpiece: but the church, the Body of Christ, is a masterpiece. We are a poem expressing God's infinite wisdom and divine design. Imagine that! We are God's masterpiece!

What a gospel it is that God the Creator became a God-man for producing the church, His masterpiece, in resurrection! And what an honor it is to be included in His masterpiece, being part of it! No wonder my heart sprang when hearing the song and singing stanzas 2 and 3--what a response to the gospel in stanza 1. This is the gospel I'd like to bring with me wherever I go and that is God the Creator became a God-man, thru and in a process, He produced the church, a wonderful work, His masterpiece! Come! Lord Jesus.
